description:
In this course, you will learn relevant fundamentals of human motor performance, perception, and cognition that inform effective interaction design.You will use these models of how people work to design more effective input and interaction techniques. You’ll apply these to both traditional graphic and gestural interfaces.

                                            Syllabus
                        This course will be available in a self-paced format. The courses in the Interaction Design Specialization may be taken in any order.In this course, you will learn relevant fundamentals of human motor performance, perception, and cognition that inform effective interaction design.You will use these models of how people work to design more effective input and interaction techniques. You’ll apply these to both traditional graphic and gestural interfaces.Topics include:
Fitt’s law Graphic interfaces Gestural interfaces
title: Interaction Techniques
